<a id="intro"></a>

### We're developing an ACCU Scheme method for<br><b>wetland repair through ungulate (hooved animal) management</b>

<br>

We've now submitted a draft document package to the Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water ([Emissions Reduction Assurance Committee Secretariat](https://www.dcceew.gov.au/climate-change/emissions-reduction/accu-scheme/assurance-committee)) for review. Please see our updated timeline below.

The document package opens with a <em>discussion paper</em> which details our method development activities to-date, presents our reply to the recent round of public consultation conducted via this website, and introduces the enclosed draft method documents:

* A draft <em>methodology determination</em>. 
* A draft <em>technical guidance document</em>.
* And an updated <em>draft simple method guide</em>. 

<div class="btn-container">
<a href="https://drive.usercontent.google.com/u/0/uc?id=1Oai8eP0vfk6XL6-ldwq2WLAgX7ocJ3LG&export=download"><button class="btndownload">Download the draft document package <em>(zipped PDFs, 3.5 MB)</em> &nbsp;&nbsp; <i class="fa fa-download"></i></button></a>
</div>

We will update the draft documents once we receive feedback from DCCEEW (ERAC Secretariat), and we expect that there will be at least one further round of public consultation in 2026.

Please [contact us](mailto:team@ungulatecarbon.com.au) if you have any further questions. Thank you for your interest in the method.

<a id="timeline"></a>

#### <b>Timeline</b>

<div class="timeline-simple">
  <p><em>Nov 2024: method EOI prioritised for development</em></p>
  <p><em>Dec 2024 &ndash; Apr 2025: method draft developed in consultation with technical working groups</em></p>
  <p><em>May 2025: method draft reviewed by working groups and federal government</em></p>
  <p><em>Jun&ndash;Jul 2025: revised method draft available for stakeholder feedback</em></p>
  <p><em>Aug 2025: stakeholder feedback reviewed and incorporated into final method draft</em></p>
  <p><b>Nov 2025:</b> draft document package delivered to DCCEEW (ERAC Secretariat) for review</p>
  <p><b>Early 2026:</b> DCCEEW (ERAC Secretariat) review received</p>
  <p><b>Mid 2026:</b> presentation at ERAC meeting; finalisation of work to support National Greenhouse Gas Inventory reporting</p>
  <p><b>Late 2026/early 2027:</b> final method document package delivered for formal ERAC assessment</p>
</div>

<a id="team"></a>

#### <b>Proponent team</b> 

This method is being co-developed by the [North Australian Indigenous Land Management Alliance](https://nailsma.org.au/) (NAILSMA) and [The University of Queensland](https://environment.uq.edu.au/) (UQ). We're working in collaboration with Indigenous peak bodies, local, state and federal governments, NGOs and industry organisations. The lead co-proponents are:
